topics.title: More Namecoin Support !!!
topics.body:
Did you know you can pay directly to to every .bit site ? Just open the Namecoin Wallet and pay to d/zeronet for Namecoin payments to zeronet.bit ;)

Great isn't it ? Why using crappy unhuman bitcoin style addys anymore ? ;)

1@131.body: And: Possible to integrate id/ support for existing Namecoin Nicknames ?
OpenID for Namecoin is available as well.
Did you know that Bitmessage is supporting Namecoin Nicknames (for example id/nofish ?)

> [p2p](#comment_39_62): it costs coin? how much for one OpenID?

You need 0,01NMC to register a Namecoin Name (in this case and id/) - thats all :)

Renewal fees are not necessary so you can keep your Namecoin identity forever.

3@2.body:
I would like to see screenshots in exchange for the green blocks. Possible ?

Or simple make a Google Site FrontSite ;) Short Link, Short Description like Google and on the right side, number of peers, etc and simply the ZERONET Logo on the Top. You don't need the search field at the moment as long as there is no working search engine for zeronet. Also you should mention on the front site that you can DONATE Namecoin directly to every example.bit site.

This would boost Namecoin Adoption amazingly and people can give Namecoin as a gift to other zeronet site owners to register their own .bit domain.

Zeronet Sites supported on this way via Namecoin human readable direct donations to d/example.bit will boost high quality content on ZeroNet !



Think about it - Win / Win Situation.

Nofish: You are on the right way ... Fight for the future !

I've seen this on reddit:

http://www.reddit.com/r/zeronet/comments/33an91/experimental_chrome_plugin_for_12700143110_site/

My opinion is:



Keep .bit, but redirect non-existent domains back to Chrome.

Is it possible to use .bit domains Hybrid Style ? That means: if IP available go to Internet if somehow marked with "Zeronet" in the JSON use it for Zeronet as well.

Possible ?

> [nofish](#comment_93_2): I think its possible, but need testing and benchmarking the performance drawbacks of it.

Oh nice - this would be really great, because i have a .bit domain which i would like to use in Zeronet first and use it hybrid style later in the Internet as well.

I've suggested some posts before a simple KISS design:

http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1@49/A+search+engine

Similar to this ? If a search isn't working good at the moment simply remove the search field and show all sites in zeronet like Google Results and on the righ side number of peers, etc.

On the TOP simply the ZeroNet Logo :D

What's working for Google can't be wrong for Zeronet.

And: You can collect donations this way on the front side (maybe for adverts as well ?) and make similar buttons for ZeroTalk, ZeroTube etc :D

Whats working for Google can't be wrong for ZeroNet !

One idea for the forum: to make administration easier is it possible to integrate a spam button ?

If enough people are pressing this button: autoremove or getting message for manual administration.

2@82.body:
Omfg :D This is like the internet the first days ? ;)

If you are Yahoo of Zeronet who will be the Google of Zeronet ?

Hail to the king, baby !

2@131.body:
I've copied this from nofish from r/Zeronet :

My opinion is: Keep .bit, but redirect non-existent domains back to chrome.

Is it possible to use .bit domains Hybrid Style ? That means: if IP available go to Internet if somehow marked with "Zeronet" in the json use it for Zeronet as well.

Possible ?

> [nofish](#comment_92_2): sorry, but this is already posted: http://127.0.0.1:43110/talk.zeronetwork.bit?Topic:1@107/127+0+0+1+43110+less+browsing+using+chrome+extension
> You can edit/delete your posts/topic by using the pencil icon that appears when you hover over your post.

Oh hello nofish, nice to meet you :D Sorry, don't like reddit much at the moment.

But can you think about my suggestion ?

Hail to the king nofish ! :D

1@82.body: Namecoin .bit domains are very resistant to DDOS attacks ..

2@77.body:
Karsten did you know that it is possible to donate directly to karsten.bit over the Namecoin Wallet ?

Simply add d/karsten as the recepient ;)

1@77.body:
Lol nice :D This is the like the first days of Internet :D

Karsten can you make a Zeronet Video just showing some features of Zeronet ?

If possible Creative Commons - some friends of me are hosting the Namecoin Youtube Channel - and they need some input :D

Or maybe somebody other ?

Hail to the king nofish, baby !

2@62.body:
What about using a Namecoin .bit domain ?

You would be able to receive direct payments for your site.

Simply open the Namecoin Wallet and pay to d/example (example.bit would get the funds in this case)

Hail to the king, nofish, baby !

1@49.body:
Lol nice :D Thats exactly what i've searched for.

Question ? How can i write a message to the guy hosting this site ? 

Would like to see Namecoin support over a .bit domain.

It's easy to donate directly to Namecoin .bit domains: Simply open the Namecoin Wallet and pay directly to for example d/zerosearch (the recepient would be zerosearch.bit in this case).

It's a cool hidden feature of Namecoin :D No spreading of crappy Bitcoin Hash Addys for donation anymore ...

Hail to the king, nofish, baby !

1@78.body:
> [nofish](#comment_59_2): sure, its opensource: https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroTalkyou can reach me at zeronet irc channel @ freenode if you have any questions

Thx nofish - great :D
